dataset.title: Welker IPY snow fence shrub site soil temperatures and soil water content Toolik, Alaska 2008.

para.literalLayout: Soil temperature from three locations on the eastern side of the Toolik River where by snow fences were established as part of IPY. This is a study of how soil temperatures at 10 cm and soil moisture change across the summer at our IPY snow fence site .

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Four locations on the eastern side of the Toolik River where by snow fences were established as part of IPY near Toolik Lake on the North Slope of Alaska

para.literalLayout: Version 1 : Mar 2011 Received file from Jeff Welker. Updated the metadata sheet and created eml files and web files. JimL Version 2: Corrected Distribution URL. It had xlsfiles in the path. Jim L 19Jun14 Version 3: Changed Distrubution URL since the LTER network DAS system is being discontinued. JimL 9Apr2015

This is soil temperature from three locations on the eastern side of the Toolik River where by snow fences were established as part of IPY. Measurements were taken at 3 locations (3 replicates) with four treatments, control, drift, drift and shoveled and drift, shoveled and watered ( C, D, DS, DSW). The three replicates were called: upper, south, north (U, S, N). At approximately biweekly periods we have measured soil temperature (oC) at 10 cm using a hand held thermometer probe inserted into the soil and we used a Water sense probe (dialectic method) to measure soil water content by volume. These measurements were taken in conjunction with our periodic CO2 flux measurements.

dataTable.entityDescription: Welker IPY snow shrub 2008 soil temperatures and soil water content Toolik, Alaska.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Locations of the set of treatments-one block consist of all four snow treatments: U = upper, S = south, N = north

textDomain.definition: Locations of the set of treatments-one block consist of all four snow treatments: U = upper, S = south, N = north

attribute.attributeDefinition: Treatment-these are the four different snow manipulation treatments, C = control where now fence was put up, D = a drift treatment which is behind the snow fence (1 m x 15 m), DS = the drift plus shoveling which involved snow removal before melt and drift, DSW = plus shoveling plus added water after melt.

textDomain.definition: Treatment-these are the four different snow manipulation treatments, C = control where now fence was put up, D = a drift treatment which is behind the snow fence (1 m x 15 m), DS = the drift plus shoveling which involved snow removal before melt and drift, DSW = plus shoveling plus added water after melt.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date is the calendar day of flux measurements
Plot is the subsamples within a treatment

textDomain.definition: Plot is the subsamples within a treatment

attribute.attributeDefinition: Type is measurements in between tussocks or on tussocks

textDomain.definition: Type is measurements in between tussocks or on tussocks

ns2:unit.name: percent
ns2:unit.ns2:description: ratio of two quantities as percent composition (1:100)
